etymologies: Middle English: probably from Old English belga, plural of belig (see belly), used as a shortened form of earlier blǣstbelig ‘blowing bag’

definitions: a device with an air bag that emits a stream of air when squeezed together with two handles, used for blowing air into a fire

examples.text: stoking up the fire with the bellows

shortDefinitions: device with air bag that emits stream of air when squeezed together with two handles

definitions: a device similar to a pair of bellows used in a harmonium or small organ.
shortDefinitions: similar device used in harmonium or small organ

definitions: an object or device with concertinaed sides to allow it to expand and contract, such as a tube joining a lens to a camera body.
shortDefinitions: object or device with concertinaed sides to allow it to expand and contract
